formattedAddress: 210 W 55th St #1, New York, NY 10019, USA
adrFormatAddress: 210 W 55th St #1, New York, NY 10019, USA

editorialSummary.text: Cozy, vintage-style lounge with velvet seating for elevated craft cocktails & sophisticated snacks.

originalText.text:
We stopped in here for a quick drink before we went to Broadway.

Service: The service was great, even though they had a reservation they were happy to give us a table for an hour and we were happy for that.

Ambiance: The place is very cute with its velvet chairs and gold tables. There are elegant lamps scattered everywhere for great lighting. They also have put a lot of thought into food and drinks presentation.

Food: We got the truffle popcorn and grilled cheese. Both were very good. They definitely didn‚Äôt skimp on the truffle in the popcorn and it was clearly fresh popped. The grilled cheese was also very good and came with a really nice jam.

Drinks: Unfortunately, the drinks really didn‚Äôt meet our expectations. They just tasted off and some tasted bitter too. It almost felt as if the ratios of ingredients were off. We ordered 4 drinks and out of 4 drinks only one was decent so that was disappointing.

Instagram: @TheShahLALand

originalText.text: This place is a hidden gem and I'm so happy a SAG event in the area forced me to dive in and explore. I used to "bartend" as did my bestie in the photos. But watching Hassan (12 years+ experience) was like being in the presence of a #Master . I have never seen so much care put into any drink in my entire life. Every glass was a work of art, and so amazing. The 2 days we spent there was the most fun I had in a long time. I wish I was in the area more. Stop by and treat yourself to a show as your exquisite drink is being crafted in a way that Gordon Ramsay would be proud of. üíØüíØ . Hassan showed me you can put drinks in a cup or you can create a drinkable work of art.. üç∑üç∏üçπü•Ç

originalText.text:
Overall - great spot and def worth trying out. Great for after dinner/show drinks. I will be coming back!

Drink highlights below:
- AMAZING
- Def worth the having a night date night with great cocktails
- For those who enjoy mock tails, I highly recommend the Paloma.

Food highlights below:
- The grilled cheese and kale artichoke dip were awesome - highly recommend
- The wagyu skewers were not worth it
- The chicken skewers were good but just a little salty - worth trying because I‚Äôm sure the saltiness was just a limited batch.

Service highlights below:
- Professional staff
- Helpful with the menu and figuring out which cocktail is best based on your preferences

Atmosphere highlights below:
- The vibe is very chill and cozy
- Easy to have a good conversation considering the volume of the music and other guests.
- Lighting is pretty bad. It‚Äôs way too dark. Just making the room one notch brighter would make a difference.

originalText.text: We didn't have food, but the drinks, service, and atmosphere were great! My husband and I went here several nights during our trip.

text.text: We didn't have food, but the drinks, service, and atmosphere were great! My husband and I went here several nights during our trip.

originalText.text:
Best cocktail spot in New York City. Hands. Down. From the drinks to the service to the ambiance‚Ä¶ we could not have been more pleased with The Rickey. I‚Äôm not sure we‚Äôve had better drinks since the pandemic. The attention to detail is exceptional. I‚Äôm also not sure we‚Äôve felt like the only people in the room and more welcome even though the place is packed. *The place is packed because it‚Äôs AMAZING!
Steven the bartender is the man.
Don‚Äôt t miss this spot if you find yourself in midtown. Also‚Ä¶ $1 grilled cheese @ happy hour?!?!?!!!! Enough said.
Go.
And be happy :)
Thank you The Rickey!
You found yourself a regular.
